rComments: karen is a great professor. She's a little difficult to approach at first and definitely can see through student's bull. But she's great in office hours, pretty interesting lecture and is well respected. Rough around the edges, but take the time to talk to her, she's so knowledgeable and loves to hear what you have to say

Karen is so inspirational, she has a great passion her life's work and study as a restoration ecologist and she definitely wants her students to succeed. Lots of readings but they are interesting and relevant! The exams are tough but doable. There's field trips, work parties, and internship opportunities with this class! A must take ENVS upper div!
Many inspiring field trips. Dr Holl is is one of the top professionals in her field of study.  Take this course, you wont regret it. Its tough, engaging, and fair.

This class was good, but Holl can be a little stand-offish and doesn't really address your concerns or questions unless she knows you. Good at forest restoration. Complaint: The expectations for papers and assignments are not clear at all, but you're graded on how well you read the TA's mind and interpret the lack of information in the prompt.

Incredibly knowledgeable and helpful teacher. One of the best environmental studies professors in the department. Incorporates field trips and interesting guest speakers. She was also my internship supervisor and provided great feedback. She even gave me advice on my UCDC application in office hours!

PASSIONATE TEACHER. Very knowledgeable. Might seem unapproachable and tends to whip through the material, but is just ADHD and scheduled tight. Ask her to slow down. Ask questions. She's awesome. If she can't answer a question, she'll look into it for you. Don't be afraid of this one!

Her restoration ecology class is super informational. She may seem like she is rude and does not care about anything, but she just has ADD. She does genuinely care about the department and every student in it.

Karen is a wealth of knowledge when it comes to this subject. That being said, she is a terrible person. Arrogant, unfriendly, and awkward or only a few adjectives that fit her description. I fully regret taking this class. Her exams are unfair, her paper prompts are dull, and the grading on both is harsh. DO NOT take this class!

Karen is great at her craft, but I'm not sure she should be teaching it. The lectures are put online, the midterms not too bad and TAs are super helpful. You write a few papers individually and in a group, so theres plenty of chances to get a good grade or improve a bad one.
Boring, loud, full of herself. Only talks about her projects in CA, doesn't reference much about the rest of the country (or world).

Karen Holl is such a dope teacher. Smart and on top of current events. If youre into this type of subject, Holl is an amazing resource. All notes online and midterm are chill. group activities and feild trips are a total plus. internship was the best thing ive done in a while. i learned so much overall!

Great class! Karen is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about restoration and ecology. Clear but fast-paced powerpoint lectures with cool case studies.  Tests consist of fill-ins, short essays, and long essays.  Several essays assigned throughout the quarter.  Cool fieldtrips and internship option also. The reader was great too.
